channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Texas A&M chancellor vows disciplinary action after professor caught teaching 'gender unicorn'
item.description: Texas A&M Chancellor Glenn Hegar said Monday that the university system will take disciplinary action after an undercover video showed a professor usi...

item.title: Exclusive: RNC Asks Justice Department To Investigate Maine’s Trump-Hating Secretary Of State
item.description: The complaint accuses Shenna Bellows of violating the National Voter Registration Act by failing to make public voter roll records.

item.title: Don’t Abandon the MMR Vaccine
item.description: The legacy of Covid-era overreach is no reason to give measles a new lease on life.

item.title: Canada’s Mark Carney: Set to Fail
item.description: Though he’ll do it in a (slightly) different way.

item.title: MAGA’s Vision for America in Retreat
item.description: A draft of a new National Defense Strategy envisions a smaller, weaker, more self-conscious America.

item.title: Watch Norah O’Donnell’s Justice Barrett ‘Interview’ To Understand How The Media Lie
item.description: From beginning to end, O'Donnell treated her 'interview' with Justice Barrett as an opportunity to try and discredit the Supreme Court.

item.title: Axios: Worst Part About Gruesome N.C. Train Stabbing Is People Noticing
item.description: 'MAGA influencers are drawing repeated attention to violent attacks to elevate the issue of urban crime.'

item.title: 'I am proud to serve': Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett opens up about being on the bench
item.description: Justice Amy Coney Barrett has opened up to CBS News about life on the Supreme Court, and suggested she misses her life before she was confirmed.

item.title: What kind of person might want to kill Trump? We're about to find out
item.description: The first trial in nearly 40 years of someone accused of nearly assassinating a president is turning into a circus.

item.title: Tim Kaine Is Unable to Say What Makes America Beautiful
item.description: A senator in need of remedial civics — and religion.

item.title: Democrats display alleged Trump note to Epstein for 50th birthday
item.description: House Democrats on Monday released a screenshot of a note that President Trump allegedly wrote to Jeffrey Epstein for his 50th birthday in 2003.

item.title: Russia Is Not a Defender of Christianity
item.description: The Russian regime is actively persecuting Christians, in Russia itself and in Russian-occupied parts of Ukraine.

item.title: Rand Paul Compared Trump Cartel Strike To Lynching, Backed Obama Droning Two Americans
item.description: Sen. Rand Paul harshly criticized a Trump administration strike on a Venezuelan cartel, but supported Obama's drone strike of Americans.

item.title: DC Would Get Much Better If More Politicians Threatened Punches Like Scott Bessent
item.description: Sometimes solving problems requires the men running the country to put their money and meat hooks where their mouths are.

item.title: Senate Republicans begin to change rules to clear backlog of Trump nominees
item.description: Senate Majority Leader John Thune said Monday he planned to begin "necessary procedural steps to amend the rules" so that Republicans could more quick...
